message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.CY, cs.AI 

This paper deals with the analysis of conflict dynamics in online discussion communities using machine learning techniques. The paper focuses on predicting the degree of conflict a news article will face from its audience and predicting if a pair of users will have a conflicting interaction. This work involves the use of natural language processing, network analysis, and machine learning, which are all relevant to the sub-categories of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.SOC (Social and Economic Networks), cs.CY (Computers and Society), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Therefore, these are the most likely sub-categories for this paper.
